Package goldfish.model.pieces

Class Piece

java.lang.Object
goldfish.model.pieces.Piece
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
public abstract class Piece extends Object
The Piece class represents a piece in the game of chess

  • Constructor Details

    • Piece

      public Piece(String color, String type, Board board)
      Superconstructor for objects that inherit the abstract Piece class.
      Parameters:
      color - Color of the piece: w = white, b = black
      type - The type of piece to create: p = pawn, R = rook, N = knight, B = bishop, Q = queen, K = king
      board - the board the piece is on

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Override toString method to return the color and type of the piece
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      format is aN where a is the color (w = white, b = black) and N is the type (p = pawn, R = rook, N = knight, B = bishop, Q = queen, K = king)

    • isEnemyAttacking

      public boolean isEnemyAttacking(int x, int y)
      Finds out if the opponent of the player that owns this piece is attacking the given tile.
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate of the tile in question
      y - y coordinate of the tile in question
      Returns:

    • putsKingInCheck

      public boolean putsKingInCheck(int x, int y)
      Checks if the king will be in check after the move. True if the king will be in check, false otherwise. Call at the end of verifyMove and only move true if this is false.
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate of the piece
      y - y coordinate of the piece
      Returns:
      boolean

    • verifyMove

      public abstract boolean verifyMove(int x, int y)
      Checks if the move is valid for the piece. True if valid, false if not.
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinate of the piece
      y - y coordinate of the piece
